Literature Collection: HBM and Injury Prevention Chapter 1 Introduction 1.1 Prerequisites

Literature Collection: HBM and Injury Prevention Jobin 2019-10-11 Chapter 1 Introduction 1.1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/.

Chapter 3 Human experiments 3.1 Human volunteers 3.2 Post-mortem human subjects (PMHS) (Shaw et al. 2009) : Impact Response of Restrained (PMHS) in Frontal Sled Tests: Skeletal Deformation Patterns Under Seat Belt Loading 3.3 Dummies (Viano and Parenteau 2018): Rear-seat occupant in rear crash test (NHTSA) 3.4 Biofidelity A Methodology for Generating Objective Targets for Quantitatively Assessing the Biofideltiy of crash test dummies (Rhule et al. 2009) References
